intro: Trichodesma zeylanicum subsp. latisepalum, commonly known as the broad-sepal trichodesma, is a flowering plant native to parts of South and Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Leguminosae, also known as the Fabaceae family, and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and showy, yellow flowers. The plant produces small, legume-like pods that contain several seeds, and it is often found in dry, open habitats. It is also valued for its medicinal properties and is used in traditional herbal remedies.
